verifySource.title: Verify the Source
verifySource.description: Always verify the origin of the news. Reliable sources have a history of responsible journalism and are recognized for their credibility.

analyzeDate.title: Analyze the Date
analyzeDate.description: Old news can be republished as if they were recent. Always check the original publication date.

searchOtherSources.title: Search Other Sources
searchOtherSources.description: If news is true, other reliable sources will also have published it. If only one unknown source has the information, be suspicious.

identifyWarningSigns.title: Identify Warning Signs

verifyMedia.title: Verify Images and Videos

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description1: Fake Lumos was born from the need to combat the growing wave of disinformation in our society. Our mission is to empower people with tools and knowledge to identify and combat fake news.
mission.description2: Through the combination of advanced technology and digital education, we seek to create a more reliable and transparent online environment.

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description1: We aspire to create a more conscious and critical society regarding the information it consumes. We envision a future where every citizen has the tools and knowledge necessary to distinguish facts from fiction.
vision.description2: We want to be a reference in the fight against disinformation, contributing to a healthier and fact-based public debate.

section1.title: 1. Information Collected
section1.content: Fake Lumos collects only the information necessary to provide the news verification service. This includes the texts you submit for analysis, which are processed temporarily and are not permanently stored.

section2.title: 2. Use of Information
section2.content: The information collected is used exclusively to provide the news verification service. We do not share, sell, or rent your personal information to third parties.

section3.title: 3. Data Storage
section3.content: Texts submitted for verification are processed and may be temporarily stored in your browser's local history (localStorage). We do not store personal data on our servers.

section4.title: 4. Cookies and Similar Technologies
section4.content: We use cookies and similar technologies to improve your experience, including accessibility preferences and theme settings. You can manage these preferences through your browser settings.

section5.title: 5. Security

section6.title: 6. Your Rights
section6.content: You have the right to access, correct, or delete your personal information. Since we do not store personal data on our servers, you can clear your browser's local history at any time.

section7.title: 7. Changes to this Policy
section7.content: We may update this Privacy Policy periodically. We recommend that you review this page regularly to stay informed about how we protect your information.

examples.title: Practical Examples
examples.description: Test the system with these news examples. Click 'Copy' to use in the verifier.
examples.footer: These are just examples. Always verify important information through multiple reliable sources.

example1.title: Fake News Example
example1.content: BREAKING: Scientists discover that drinking water causes cancer. Study reveals that 100% of people who drank water developed the disease. Experts recommend avoiding water completely.
example1.description: This is a clear example of fake news with alarmist claims and no reliable sources.

example2.title: True News Example
example2.content: The World Health Organization (WHO) recommends drinking at least 2 liters of water per day to maintain good hydration. This recommendation is based on peer-reviewed scientific studies.
example2.description: This news contains verifiable information and cites reliable sources like WHO.

example3.title: Partially True News Example
example3.content: Recent study shows that coffee can prevent heart disease. Researchers found that drinking 5 cups per day reduces risk by 50%. Everyone should start drinking coffee immediately.
example3.description: This news mixes real facts (coffee may have benefits) with exaggerations and unfounded recommendations.

content.title: Free Fake News Verifier - Fake News Detector with AI
content.paragraph1: Welcome to Fake Lumos, the best fake news verifier and fake news detector available online. Our tool uses advanced artificial intelligence from Google Gemini to analyze and verify news veracity in seconds, helping you combat disinformation and identify fake news quickly and efficiently.
content.paragraph2: As a free fake news verifier, we offer a complete fact-checking solution that analyzes multiple aspects of content, including sources, language patterns, verifiable facts, and disinformation indicators. Our fake news detector is easy to use and requires no registration or payment.
content.subtitle1: Why use our fake news verifier?
content.paragraph3: In a world where disinformation spreads rapidly, having access to a reliable fake news detector is essential. Our fake news verifier uses cutting-edge artificial intelligence technology to provide detailed and accurate analyses, helping you make informed decisions about the content you consume and share.
content.subtitle2: Features of our fake news detector
content.paragraph4: Our fake news verifier offers various advanced features:
content.feature1: Instant analysis with Google Gemini artificial intelligence
content.feature2: Reliability score and detailed classification (True, False, Partial, etc.)
content.feature3: Identification of true, false, and suspicious elements
content.feature4: Real-time search for reliable sources for recent news
content.paragraph5: Whether you're a journalist, researcher, educator, or citizen concerned about information veracity, our fake news verifier is here to help you. Use our free tool whenever you need to verify a suspicious news item and help combat disinformation on the internet.
